Event.name: Becoming_separated
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Whole</fen> separates into <fen>Parts</fen>, or one part of a whole, called <fen>Part_1</fen>, becomes separate from the remaining portion, <fen>Part_2</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Whole">This small channel</fex> meanders through marsh and wetland, <t>splitting</t> <fex name="Parts">into several smaller channels that empty into Lake St. Clair</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Just crack one open and if <fex name="Part_1">the yoke</fex> <fex name="Manner">quickly</fex> <t>separates</t> <fex name="Part_2">from the whites</fex>, they are probably bad.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Whole
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which separates into <fen>Parts</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Whole">Metalworkers' union</fex> to <t>split</t> into regional divisions</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Parts
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
<ex>These daughter chromosomes then begin to <t>separate</t> <fex name="Parts">from each other</fex>, each moving away from the metaphase plate and toward one of the two spindle pole regions.</ex> <ex>Watch as they <t>split</t> <fex name="Parts">into many differently-shaped bits</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Part_1
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned.
<ex>Initially, <fex name="Part_1">the front part</fex> <t>separated</t> from the rest of the body.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Part_2
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Part_2 is the second of two Parts mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement.
<ex>Initially the front <t>split</t> <fex name="Part_2">from the rest of the body</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Criterion
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element expresses a property of the Parts or components of the Whole which correlates with the separation. Criterion is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of</ment>.... <ex>Particles will therefore only <t>separate</t> <fex name="Crit">on the basis of contact angle</fex> as long as their mass is between an upper and lower critical value.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the undergoers of the separation.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An intermediate action or event that enables the separation.
<ex>Explore how cells <t>divide</t> <fex name="Mns">by undergoing mitosis</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of an event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
<ex>However it is believed they <t>separated</t> <fex name="Time">at least 2 if not 3 million years ago</fex>.</ex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Where the separation occurs.
<ex>The two parts likely <t>separated</t> <fex name="Place">above the Atlantic</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: split.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come into pieces, especially violently.
